module.name: ap239_task_specification_resourced
module.name.french: Spécification de tàches de l'AP 239 avec ressources

purpose.p: This part of ISO 10303 specifies an application module for the representation of tasks with associated resources. It also enables the assignment of such tasks to products and the grouping and ordering of tasks.

This part of ISO 10303 thus provides a capability to define and exchange a computer interpretable description of the work required to support a complex engineered asset throughout its service life. It can also represent the information typically provided in repair manuals and other technical documentation that specify manual tasks.

These capabilities are achieved by linking application module Task specification (ISO 10303-1262) to the application modules used to define resources, locations, conditions and justifications. Further details are presented below.
The capabilities provided by this part of ISO 10303 include:

ul.li: the identification of resources required by tasks;
the identification of products to which tasks are assigned;
the association of properties with task specifications;
the association of dates, times, people, approvals and other management data with task specifications;
the specification of conditions under which a task falls due;
the association of a justification and a probability with a task assignment to a product, or a resource assignment to a task;
the association of a location with a task or resource;
the association of a task specification with the requirement from which it derived.

purpose.p: The planning and scheduling of activities on individual products is out of scope.

The Task specification module represents the data that specifies a task. This may include definition of the logical sequence of task steps required to achieve the task objective. Within this part of ISO 10303 a task specification may be extended by defining required resources, and by relating the task to products, product breakdown elements, zones, interfaces and locations.
The kinds of resources that may be defined for a task include:

ul.li: products, either types of product or individual products;
people, types of people, organizations, types of organization, or positions within organizations;
documents and information held as files.

purpose.p: The resource allocation, and the assignment of the task to a product, may be qualified by a condition, a justification or a probability. The conditions may be stated in terms of the state of the product, its age, its usage or any other parameter. Justifications can be related to supporting data or documents. A required resource may be related to a location.
This module uses the functionality of the following significant modules:
The module provides representation of the data that specify tasks.

The module provides the means to represent planned or actual outputs from an activity or a task, and to characterize these outputs in terms of identifiers, approvals and security classification. Examples of work output include products, certificates and records of measurements taken.

The Requirement_assignment module represents relationships between requirements and items to which they are assigned, and between requirements and the items that are their source. Within this part of ISO 10303 the above module is be used to relate a task specification to the support driver from which it arose and, if appropriate, to link the support driver back to a fault state, or other source information, from which it derives.
The Required_resource_characterized module provides representation and characterization of resources required to achieve a specified objective.
The Resource_as_realized module provides representation of specific existing resources that may be required to perform a task.
The Resource_item module is used to represent entities defined elsewhere that may act as a resource. A product from one viewpoint may be a resource from another.
The Resource_management module enables the representation of resource management data such as intended resource location and quantity.

The
Organization_type module enables identification of a type of organization.

The Person_organization module, when used with the Person_organization_assignment module, allows individual people and organizations to be linked to a task specification. A
Position_in_organization may also be related to a task.

The
Type_of_person module may be used with the Experience and Qualifications modules to specify the type of person required to perform a task.
The Document_assignment module enables documents to be linked to task specifications.
The AP239_management_resource_information module enables relevant characterization of the task specification itself.

inscope.li: the identification of resources required by tasks;
the identification of products to which tasks are assigned;
the association of properties with task specifications;
the association of dates, times, people, approvals and other management data with task specifications;
the specification of conditions under which a task falls due;
the association of a justification and a probability with a task assignment to a product, or a resource assignment to a task;
the association of a location with a task or resource.

outscope.li: work orders, work requests such as are used in preparing for actual work;
schemes, plans and schedules for performing sets of tasks.

uof.name: Task_specification_resourced
uof.description: The UOF enables the association of a task specification with the identification of resources necessary to carry out the task. It also enables the association of the task with the products on which the task is to be carried out.
